subject: RE: [junit] Code is fast with JUnit but rediculously slow when run through its own main
msgSnippet: Hi Alle ISSUE SOLVED! It was some static setting in our setUp()! And, no, I have not tried running it through a profiler and, yes, that would have pointed
messageBody:
Hi Alle

ISSUE SOLVED!

It was some static setting in our setUp()!

And, no, I have not tried running it through a profiler and, yes, that would
have pointed right to the problem!

Thanks.

Morten




> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> Ilja Preuss
> Sent: 09 September 2005 14:05
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Code is fast with JUnit but rediculously slow when
> run through its own main
>
> > I have code that is fast when I run it in my JUnit Test but
> > ridiculously slow (about 10000 to 100000 times slower) when I run it
> > through its own main.
> >
> > We HAVE checked that -Xmx -Xss options are identical.
> >
> > Any ideas?
>
> What is your main doing that the test isn't?
>
> Have you tried running the code (when executed through main) through a
> profiler?
>
> Cheers, Ilja
>
